text: Shooting many smaller projectiles instead of one large one is more effective when fighting multiple small targets, such as infantry units.
Shooting a single, large projectile instead of many smaller ones is more effective when fighting larger single targets, such as monsters.
The Deathshrieker Rocket is made up of multiple packed warheads, which detonate in the air above the battlefield in a storm of fire and plunge multiple tendrils of flame downwards from the blast.
Demolition Rockets use densely packed explosive warheads with delayed fuses in a strengthened iron tube to channel the blast against a single point.
A single, large piece of ordnance, designed to maim and kill, en masse, on contact.
Due to this projectile's fiendish design, whichever direction you choose to run is the wrong one!
Made using secret techniques, these shells strike with a crack and rumble that mirrors Tor's mighty lightning, shattering clustered foes.
Bolts of blessed light melt through armour to sear the flesh beneath.
Once loosed, these arrows splinter into scores of poisonous thorns that seek the flesh of Athel Lorenâ€™s enemies.
Engineers have refined both rifle and shot to guarantee the highest possible propulsion and penetration.
The gunpowder used in these shots is so volatile that it often explodes before reaching the target. Get as close as you can before firing, but not *too* close!
